meanings.definition: A subdivision or subgroup within a larger group or organization.
meanings.sent1: In the biology class, we learned about a subsect of mammals called primates.
meanings.sent2: The subsect of students interested in art formed a club at school.
meanings.sent3: The subsect of cats who love water is quite rare.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a subsect of the team, always on the outskirts.
meanings.sent5: The subsect of flowers that bloom at night is fascinating to study.

meanings.definition: To divide or classify into smaller groups or categories.
meanings.sent1: I need to subsect the books on the shelf by genre.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will subsect the students into groups for the project.
meanings.sent3: He decided to subsect his wardrobe by color to make it easier to find clothes.
meanings.sent4: Her mind seemed to subsect thoughts into neat compartments.
meanings.sent5: The chef will subsect the ingredients before starting to cook.
